There can be no law-keeping, of course, that does not tend to appearance. Even the character bestowed by God, a reward of secret communion, must be an open reward. The city set on a hill cannot be hid ; the candle must be allowed to shine; the good works of saith are God's glory upon earth; but, mark this, the light of such character as can truly shine comes from the eye of faith turned God-ward. lf the eye be turned otherwhere it is dis- tinctly said that the very appearance of light will be darkness.
